title: Herding Cows Tips Secrets for Happy and Healthy Livestock

tasks.task: Ride the tractor and adjust the combine setting for threshing wheat
subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat and steer it
Look out the front of the tractor to monitor the wheat
Apply pressure to the pedals to control speed and functions
Use the control levers to adjust the combine settings
Check the combine's grain tank level periodically
Stop the machine periodically for maintenance checks
Observe surroundings for any obstructions or hazards

tasks.task: Operate the grain auger to unload wheat
subtasks: Approach the combine with the grain auger
Align the auger with the unloader flap
Start the auger and monitor for proper operation
Manage the grain flow as it's being unloaded
Check for any blockages or issues during operation
Stop the auger when the bin is full

tasks.task: Unload the grain bin onto a truck
subtasks: Position the truck near the grain bin
Open the truck bed and secure the tarp if necessary
Operate the grain auger to load the grain into the truck
Monitor the loading process to prevent overfilling
Close the truck bed and secure the tarp when done

tasks.task: Surround the combine with the grain auger
subtasks: Position the auger near the unloader of the combine
Extend the auger as needed to reach the combine
Operate the auger controls to position the auger correctly
Maintain a safe distance from the combine while operating the auger

tasks.task: Transfer wheat from the combine to the truck using the grain auger
subtasks: Ensure the grain auger is properly connected to both machines
Start the auger and adjust the flow rate as needed
Monitor the transfer to catch any spills or issues
Stop the auger when the desired amount is transferred

tasks.task: Adjust the combine's corn header for harvesting corn
subtasks: Locate the corn header attachment on the combine
Remove the current header and replace it with a corn header
Secure the new header to the combine and ensure a proper fit
Check the header for any loose or damaged parts
Calibrate the header settings according to the crop type
Test the header operation before starting the harvest

tasks.task: Operate the combine to harvest corn
subtasks: Drive the combine through the corn field
Adjust the combine's speed to optimize harvest efficiency
Monitor the corn being cut and collected
Stop periodically to check the grain tank and empty if needed
Check for any engine or mechanical issues during operation

tasks.task: Load the combine onto a trailer
subtasks: Position the combine on a flatbed trailer
Tie down the combine securely to the trailer with straps
Jack up the trailer to attach rubber skid plates if necessary
Connect the trailer to the tow vehicle and check for any leaks

tasks.task: Transport the combine to a different field
subtasks: Drive the combine and trailer combination to the new field
Align the trailer with the entry point of the field
Engage the brakes and wedge the trailer in place if necessary
Disconnect the combine from the trailer once at the field

tasks.task: Remove the corn header from the combine
subtasks: Locate the corn header on the combine
Disconnect the header from the combine's harvest system
Lift the header off the combine and place it safely
Store the header properly for next use

tasks.task: Inspect the combine for necessary maintenance before next use
subtasks: Check filters, oil levels, and hydraulic fluid
Lubricate moving parts and check for any damages
Test all functions of the combine including lights and alarms
